intro: Maddenia fujianensis, commonly known as the Fujian maddenia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or along stream banks. It has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
